marketNews.title: Indonesia plans sugar-sweetened beverage tax (MBDK) targeting 3.8 trillion rupiah in 2025
marketNews.content: Director of Reception and Strategic Planning of the Directorate General of Customs and Excise, Ministry of Finance, Muhammad Aflah Farobi, said that the government is planning to socialize a sugar-sweetened beverage tax (MBDK) to companies. He indicated that the implementation of the MBDK tax will be carried out soon because the government needs large revenue next year. The target revenue from the MBDK tax is 3.8 trillion rupiah in 2025.

marketNews.title: Indonesia's Energy Minister proposes VAT exemption for oil and gas exploration
marketNews.content: Energy and Mineral Resources Minister Bahlil Lahadalia will propose to Finance Minister Sri Mulyani Indrawati that oil and gas exploration activities be exempted from value-added tax (VAT). He argued that exploration does not guarantee oil and gas production, so a "sweetener" is needed to attract investors. Instead of paying VAT upfront, he suggested that VAT be paid later, after oil and gas are discovered.

marketNews.title: 26 Indonesian state-owned enterprises undergo board changes, with upcoming PLN deputy CEO replacement
marketNews.content: Kontan reported that up to now, 26 state-owned enterprises (BUMN) have experienced changes in directors and commissioners. The source disclosed that there is a planned next change for the position of deputy chief executive officer of PT PLN. BUMN observer from Datanesia Institute, Herry Gunawan, said that 2024 records the highest number of senior BUMN reshuffles.

marketNews.title: US Bureau of Economic Analysis revises Q3 2024 GDP growth to 3.1% YoY
marketNews.content: The US Bureau of Economic Analysis revised the third-quarter 2024 gross domestic product (GDP) growth upward to 3.1% year-on-year, based on the third estimate. This figure is higher than the second estimate of 2.8% YoY and above the consensus expectation of no change in US economic growth.

marketNews.title: US Congress fails to reach budget agreement, risking partial shutdown
marketNews.content: On Thursday, December 19, the US House of Representatives failed to reach an agreement on the federal budget bill. If Congress does not find a solution by Friday, December 20, the US government could face a partial shutdown that would disrupt government activities ahead of the Christmas period.

tickerNews.title: TPMA forms joint venture with KKGI, potential additional net profit ~7.6%
tickerNews.content: Trans Power Marine (TPMA) together with Resources Alam Indonesia (KKGI) announced the establishment of a joint venture (JV) named PT Trans Bahtera Pioneer (TBP). The JV will operate in coal transportation and logistics services in East Kalimantan, a region that produced 210 million tons of coal in 2023, equivalent to about 30% of national production. One of TBP's future clients will be PT Insani Bara Perkasa, a KKGI subsidiary that produced 5.3 million tons in 2023. Ownership of the JV is 50% KKGI and 50% TPMA with an initial capital of 51.5 billion rupiah, so each issuer will contribute 25.75 billion rupiah. The JV's contribution will be reported in both issuers' financial statements using the equity method. In its development plan, TBP will invest 200 billion rupiah to purchase six tugboat and barge sets (used or new) in the first year (2025). The cooperation is expected to expand to 20 sets in the coming years. Financing will consist of at least 20% internal cash and the remainder through bank loans. Previously, TPMA expanded through several JVs. In 2021, TPMA formed PT Trans Logistik Perkasa (TLP) together with T&J Industrial Holding Limited (TJI) – an entity of Tsingshan Holding Group – and Pacific Pelayaran Indonesia. In early September 2024, TPMA also founded Trans Ocean Permata (TOP), a joint venture with PT Samudra Investama Maju. Key Takeaway: Based on a conservative estimate and management input, TBP could add net profit of 2.5 million US dollars when the fleet reaches 20 sets, representing 7.6% of the FY25 TPMA net profit estimate of 32.4 million US dollars (before TBP contribution). With six ships in the first year, TBP could generate net profit of 461 thousand US dollars, equal to 1.4% of the FY25 TPMA net profit estimate. Assumptions used: addition of six ships phased, with two ships in 1Q25 and four ships in 2Q-4Q25; TBP revenue is expected to be lower than TOP in 2025 due to faster delivery expectations for TOP; revenue per set assumed at 1.1 billion rupiah per month (approximately 683 thousand US dollars) for tug and barge, similar to TLP which has the lowest per-set revenue among TPM and BEST; net profit margin assumed at 30%, same as TOP.

tickerNews.title: ACES reports same-store sales growth (SSSG) +9% YoY for 11M24, beating target
tickerNews.content: Aspirasi Hidup Indonesia (ACES) recorded same-store sales growth (SSSG) of +6.0% year-on-year in November 2024 (versus October 2024: +4.8% YoY, November 2023: +10% YoY). This result brings the SSSG for the first eleven months of 2024 (11M24) to +9.0% YoY (versus 11M23: +7.6% YoY), above the FY24 management guidance of +8%. Outside Java (+7.9% YoY) was the region with the highest SSSG in November 2024, followed by Java outside Jakarta (+5.7% YoY) and Jakarta (+3.2% YoY). ACES opened one new store in Lampung in November 2024, bringing the total new stores for 11M24 to 16.

tickerNews.title: NINE announces planned acquisition by Poh Group Pte. Ltd
tickerNews.content: Techno9 Indonesia (NINE) announced a plan for the acquisition of the company by Poh Group Pte. Ltd, a Singaporean coal and mining firm. Poh Group Pte. Ltd intends to purchase approximately 70% of NINE shares held by the majority shareholders Heddy Kandoi and Noproan Fadli, as well as several minority shareholders. The final price and transaction timing are still under negotiation. After the transaction, Poh Group Pte. Ltd will become the new controlling shareholder of NINE and will carry out a mandatory tender offer in accordance with applicable regulations.

tickerNews.title: CAKK director sells entire 50.8 million shares (4.22%) at 145 IDR per share
tickerNews.content: The President Director of Cahayaputra Asa Keramik (CAKK), Johan Silitonga, sold all of his shares in CAKK, amounting to 50.8 million shares (equivalent to 4.22% of the company), at a transaction price of 145 rupiah per share on 19 December 2024. The total transaction value reached approximately 7.4 billion rupiah.

tickerNews.title: SRTG sells ~708 million PALM shares at 350 IDR per share
tickerNews.content: Shareholder Provident Investasi Bersama, Saratoga Investama Sedaya (SRTG), sold approximately 708 million PALM shares at a price of 350 rupiah per share on 12 and 16 December 2024. The total transaction value reached about 247 billion rupiah. After this transaction, SRTG's ownership in PALM decreased from 8.97% to 4.48%.

tickerNews.title: ICBP confirms exported products comply with food safety regulations
tickerNews.content: Indofood CBP Sukses Makmur (ICBP) disclosed that all products the company officially exports abroad comply with applicable food safety requirements, regulations, and standards. This statement responds to the recall of several Indomie product variants from the Australian market. The company clarified that the recalled products were not officially exported by ICBP. Furthermore, ICBP explained that all its instant noodle products officially exported to Australia can continue to be marketed and distributed normally by official distributors, without any recall or hold by Australian authorities.

tickerNews.title: KEJU announces bonus share distribution plan
tickerNews.content: Shareholder Mulia Boga Raya approved a bonus share distribution plan for KEJU with a ratio of 4:11 based on the share premium capitalization valued at 206.3 billion rupiah as of 31 December 2023. The cum date is on the regular market and negotiation on 27 December 2024, with distribution scheduled for 17 January 2025.

tickerNews.title: Supreme Court rejects bankruptcy appeal of SRIL (Sritex)
tickerNews.content: The Supreme Court officially rejected the cassation request of Sri Rejeki Isman (SRIL) or Sritex regarding the bankruptcy ruling filed by Indo Bharat Rayon on Wednesday, 18 December 2024. Sritex has decided to pursue a judicial review of the decision.
